thread.title: Red Devils look to seize opportunity
thread.title_full: Red Devils look to seize opportunity

title: Red Devils look to seize opportunity
text:
Red Devils look to seize opportunity Josh Chapin , jchapin@richmond.gannett.com 5:34 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Richmond's Lexus Perkins tips the ball against Union County during a volleyball game Tuesday, Sept. 8, 2015, at Liberty. (Photo: Palladium-Item Joshua Smith) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Matt Fisher sees this as a golden opportunity for the Red Devils. 
His Richmond volleyball team drew not only a perennial sectional contender in New Castle but also the host of Class 4A Sectional 9. 
"We're excited about the challenge," Fisher said. 
And about the chance at some redemption. 
New Castle knocked off Richmond 2-0 in pool play Sept. 12 during the New Castle Invitational. 
Fisher does not believe his team was at its best that day. 
"That was probably our worst game of the year," he said. "We were able to review that match and we have a game plan going in." 
Richmond and New Castle face off at 7:30 p.m. Thursday in the second match of the sectional's opening round. Greenfield-Central will play Pendleton Heights at 6 p.m. 
Mount Vernon and Connersville both received byes to Saturday's semifinal round. Semifinal matches are at 11 a.m. and 12:30 p.m., with the final scheduled for 7 p.m. that night. 
"Our sectional is still extremely competitive," Fisher said. "It will certainly be interesting this year to see who comes out on top." 
Richmond finished its regular season 22-11 and placed third in the North Central Conference Tournament. 
While Fisher wanted to see the Red Devils play for a title that day, he was happy with their response to a semifinal loss as they rebounded to defeat Harrison in the third-place match. 
It's a similar reaction he wants to see Thursday. 
"It was probably the one we wanted the most, to be able to prove to ourselves we can play much better than we played the first time," Fisher said of drawing the Trojans. "Our girls know the first time around we did not give it our best effort and play to our ability. We are extremely determined. 
"They (the Trojans) have a really good middle who has led their offense this year we have to look out for. They've played some good teams throughout the state and play a good schedule. ... As a coach, you like to see how much your team has gained over the year, and certainly New Castle will be a good measuring stick for that." 
Josh Chapin: (765) 973-4463 jchapin@pal-item.com or twitter.com/JoshChapinPI 
Class 4A Sectional 9 
Match 1: Greenfield-Central vs. Pendleton Heights, 6 p.m. Thursday 
Match 2: Richmond vs. New Castle, 7:30 p.m. Thursday 
Match 3: Match 1 winner vs. Match 2 winner, 11 a.m. Saturday 
Match 4: Mt. Vernon vs. Connersville, 12:30 p.m. Saturday 
Match 5: Championship, 7 p.m. Saturday Read or Share this story: http://pinews.co/1RUzsd9 TOP VIDEOS
